alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 02 at 4:21AM HST until January 02 at 7:30AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 730 AM HST. * At 421 AM HST, the Hanalei River gage reported a rapid rise in water level. The river has reached a level which typically results in the closure of Kuhio Highway near the Hanalei River Bridge due to water over the roadway. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Stream Gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The entire island of Kauai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 730 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
